This page presents selected communication and knowledge translation initiatives I have contributed to.

### **Invited Talks and Interviews**
**August 2025**: 
At the [Digital Health Research Series](https://www.bcchr.ca/digital-health-research/seminars-events) hosted by the Women's Health Research Institute and BC Children's Research Institute in Canada, I presented my application of machine learning to develop a predictive model for pain-related quality of life after endometriosis surgery, and the subsequent presentation of the Endometriosis Pain Index as an online calculator using R Shiny ***(Timestamp at 40:35)***. I shared the platform with other experts in machine learning, digital health, and artificial intelligence, Dr. John-Jose Nunez (MD) and Michael Li.

{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-_IdPaecSdU&t=2453s >}}



**August 2022**:
The WomensResearch Podcast on Spotify featured a discussion of my journey into women’s health research, including progress updates since receiving the BC Graduate Award in Women’s Health Research the previous year (2021).

### **Workshops**
**October 2025**:

At the 2025 Arthritis Research Canada Trainee Day, themed around the advancement of AI in health research, I delivered a workshop titled “AI Prompting for Success,” which focused on using large language models and prompt engineering to enhance trainee development in graduate research.
